# EKError.Code.invalidSpan

**Case**

The system encountered an invalid span during a save or deletion.

## Declaration

```swift
case invalidSpan
```

## Constants

- **EKError.Code.eventNotMutable**: The event isn’t mutable and you can’t save or delete it.
- **EKError.Code.noCalendar**: The event isn’t associated with a calendar.
- **EKError.Code.noStartDate**: The event has no start date set.
- **EKError.Code.noEndDate**: The event has no end date set.
- **EKError.Code.datesInverted**: The event’s end date occurs before its start date.
- **EKError.Code.internalFailure**: An internal error occurred.
- **EKError.Code.calendarReadOnly**: The calendar is read-only and you can’t add events to it.
- **EKError.Code.durationGreaterThanRecurrence**: The duration of an event is greater than its recurrence interval.
- **EKError.Code.alarmGreaterThanRecurrence**: The alarm interval is greater than the recurrence interval.
- **EKError.Code.startDateTooFarInFuture**: The start date is further into the future than the calendar can display.
- **EKError.Code.startDateCollidesWithOtherOccurrence**: The event’s start date collides with another occurrence of the event.
- **EKError.Code.objectBelongsToDifferentStore**: The object belongs to a different calendar store.
- **EKError.Code.invitesCannotBeMoved**: You can’t move the event because it’s an invitation.
- **EKError.Code.calendarHasNoSource**: You can’t save the calendar without setting a source first.
- **EKError.Code.calendarSourceCannotBeModified**: You can’t move the calendar to another source.
